description: Students expand their ability to communicate in French, understand French texts and interpret
French and U.S. cultures through study and discussion of specific social and cultural topics that
are relevant (e.g. stereotypes, the family, education, immigration). Explicit focus on
cross-cultural comparison/contrast and analysis. Students develop their ability to listen, speak,
read and write, while paying particular attention to listening and reading strategies.
Prerequisite: French 112 or placement.  Offered each semester.
